item.title: [UPDATED] gfx, command help [317]
item.dc:creator: @oniscape oniscape
item.description:
@oniscape wrote:

[quote=“b15, post:9, topic:359307”]yea i was not watching where i put it. thanks!

hey the GFX is repeating EXTREMELY fast. is there any way for me to slow it down?[/quote]

It is repeating due to the fact process processes every 500 milis. It is your choice to choose how to slow it down but heres an example on how:

  1. Add the variable “public long doGFXT;” wherever I told you to add it last time.

  2. Replace the process code I gave you with this:

if(doGFX != -1 && System.currentTimeMillis() - doGFXT > 1000) {// the time in milis you want it to repeat
stillgfx(doGFX, absY, absX);
doGFXT = System.currentTimeMillis();
}

Correct me if i’m wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATED] gfx, command help [317]
item.dc:creator: @oniscape oniscape
item.description:
@oniscape wrote:

What I find funny is that noob’s who can’t code resort to runescape private servers, but thats besides the fact.

An explanation of why his solve didn’t work:

  1. The customcommand void never stopped due to the WHILE and the packetprocess stopped, therefore crashing the server.

  2. Why evaluate a variable to false, and then use it in the opposite way? " while(true){ " is a better way.

But thats for further reference just in case you wan’t to solve anything else in the near future.

How to make it work:

  1. Declare: “public int doGFX = -1;” at the top of client.java below the imports.

  2. Make the command:

if (command.startsWith("aaffkk")) {
            doGFX = 277;
}
  1. Make the command: (this makes it so you may stop the emote)
if (command.startsWith("stopemote")) {
            doGFX = -1;
}
  1. Go to the “process()” declaration or VOID and add the code:
if(doGFX != -1)
stillgfx(doGFX, absY, absX);

Enjoy. There is a better way but i’m not spoon feeding the best ways to do everything. Pce.

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATED] gfx, command help [317]
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:2, topic:359307”]You need to add a loop to the program. I’m not the best programmer, but I think this should work:

[code=javascript]boolean loop = false;

if (command.startsWith(“aaffkk”)) {
while(!loop){
stillgfx(277, absY, absX); //Hole in ground
}
}[/code]

It doesn’t matter where you declare the boolean, as long as it stays within the method your ‘if’ statement is.[/quote]

thanks for responding! i declared the boolean but the line:

while(!loop){

there is something wrong with it im guessing. when i type ::aaffkk i lagged out.

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATED] gfx, command help [317]
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

You need to add a loop to the program. I’m not the best programmer, but I think this should work:

[code=javascript]boolean loop = false;

if (command.startsWith(“aaffkk”)) {
while(!loop){
stillgfx(277, absY, absX); //Hole in ground
}
}[/code]

It doesn’t matter where you declare the boolean, as long as it stays within the method your ‘if’ statement is.

Read full topic

item.title: [UPDATED] gfx, command help [317]
item.dc:creator: @b15 b15
item.description:
@b15 wrote:

ok i made a command now i want the gfx to contine and keep repeating. how do i do this?

here is the command that needs to be edited so the gfx will repeat over and over.

if (command.startsWith("aaffkk")) { stillgfx(277, absY, absX); //Hole in ground }

Read full topic
